meanings.definition: To discharge or release (something) before it is due or expected.
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to predischarging the students early from class due to the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent2: The company was predischarging their new product to create excitement among customers.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be predischarging its energy by running around the house in circles.
meanings.sent4: The flowers predischarged their sweet fragrance into the air, welcoming the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The chef was predischarging the aroma of freshly baked bread throughout the restaurant.

meanings.definition: The act of discharging or releasing something before it is due or expected.
meanings.sent1: The predischarging of the fireworks startled the audience with its unexpected display.
meanings.sent2: The predischarging of the students from school caused confusion among the parents.
meanings.sent3: The predischarging of the balloons at the party made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: The predischarging of emotions during the meeting led to a heated discussion among colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The predischarging of the news about the surprise party spread quickly among the guests.
